conclusion: To determine the position of the particle at t = 8 seconds, calculate the displacement using the area under the v-t graph.
The particle starts at x = 5 meters at t = 0.
Displacement is the area under the v-t graph from t = 0 to t = 8 seconds.
From t = 0 to t = 2 seconds, velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s, forming a right triangle.
Area from t = 0 to t = 2 seconds is 2 meters.
From t = 2 to t = 4 seconds, velocity is constant at 2 m/s, forming a rectangle.
Area from t = 2 to t = 4 seconds is 4 meters.
From t = 4 to t = 5 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s, forming a right triangle.
Area from t = 4 to t = 5 seconds is 1 meter.
From t = 5 to t = 7 seconds, velocity is constant at -1 m/s, forming a rectangle.
Area from t = 5 to t = 7 seconds is -2 meters.
From t = 7 to t = 8 seconds, velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0 m/s, forming a right triangle.
Area from t = 7 to t = 8 seconds is -0.5 meters.
